abstract: In an effort to placate the Chinese government and preserve its Web site in China, Google is ending its automatic redirecting of Chinese users to its site in Hong Kong.
snippet: In an effort to placate the Chinese government and preserve its Web site in China, Google is ending its automatic redirecting of Chinese users to its site in Hong Kong.
lead_paragraph: 10:01 a.m. | Updated  See our more detailed article about this development.

headline.main: Google Will Stop Redirecting Chinese Searchers to Hong Kong

abstract: The move is an effort to appease Beijing as Google seeks to renew its license to operate in mainland China.
snippet: The move is an effort to appease Beijing as Google seeks to renew its license to operate in mainland China.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Google plans to stop automatically sending users in mainland China to its uncensored Hong Kong site, in an effort to appease Beijing as it seeks to renew its license to operate in China.

headline.main: Google to Stop Redirecting China Users
headline.print_headline: Google Takes Step To Placate China

byline.original: By Brad Stone and David Barboza
